task.summary: Default task
Testing PyCharm git tool
Testing PyCharm git tool
Updated animations for the player to import the new spritesheet, have setup new method to pull images that should work regardless of the sheet size as long as we know which animation is what

Added some docstrings and comments. Also added regex to replace the _right with _left in the animTypes for adding animations to pyganim. I still need to change over the Monster class and subclasses to use the new method.

added hitmask changes to Player class, the hitmask is now pulled from a dict created in the get_images method which should be much faster than generating it on the fly, this is not implemented in the Monster class yet.
Moved the get_images method into the Character class and changed the Monster subclasses to use it to grab their images and hitmasks from it
Added file character.py which contains the base class info for Player and Monster classes to separate it out from the subclasses
Cleaned up imports to reduce some memory usage
minor changes
minor changes to more PEP-8 compliant
minor changes to be more PEP-8 compliant

Started sorting out platform X movement, player at this point will move with platform while touching it, but will not carry inertia.
Player inertia has been implemented, at the moment the player will speed up and slow down at the same rate, this may become one value later.
minor changes

some fixes for the platform moving on the X axis, still needs some tweaks, mainly player need to move with the platform a bit after leaving it, carrying the x_vel of the platform doesn't seem to be enough. Also need to fix player warping on top of platform when collidiing with sides, this may be a non-issue in actual gameplay as most horizantally moving platforms will be drop-down type.
Also made some tweaks to the 'fat_mask' for detecting walls when airborne, still needs more polish, also found that the normal wall detector needs tweaking, need to nail down final images for player to make them 'perfect'
Implemented contorllers, well at least an xbox controller, jumping and running and moving all seem to work, will need to implement more methods when other actions are added to the game.
minor changes
Added some collision between the player and mobs
basic collision and bouncing off of mobs working, need to integrate death animations and pass .kill() to mobs

Changed the take_damage method to push the character based on the location of what is doing damage, if what is doing damage is in the mid 16 pixels of a character (from something like a jump) the character that took damage will not move.
I also added some extra arguments to take_damage to input the offset, and velocity that the character taking damage will be pushed.
tweaked the area for no movement when damaging something, may need further tuning.

Cleaned up the code in main.py, changed the buttons to objects instead of creating the images in the loop (dunno wtf I was originally doing) so there is now a 'Button' Class in main.py that we can use to make the rest of the buttons, we may want to further tweak this to make the main screen more customizable
Changed over to new sprite sheets separating the characters ears from the body, currently the ears are not showing up, still trying to sort out why that image is not blitting to the screen correctly.

Ears are now showing up, forgot to tell it the rect location upon spawning. I also moved the ears to be instanciation of the ears object into the Player class itself, I will replicate this for the masks when we get there, this will allow the masks to spawn in without having to add them in the lvl section, and avoiding more additions to the .tmx file, this way we can also easily specify in the class of the monster if we want to have a mask type object or not.

MESSAGE.value: Testing PyCharm git tool
Updated animations for the player to import the new spritesheet, have setup new method to pull images that should work regardless of the sheet size as long as we know which animation is what

Added some docstrings and comments. Also added regex to replace the _right with _left in the animTypes for adding animations to pyganim. I still need to change over the Monster class and subclasses to use the new method.

added hitmask changes to Player class, the hitmask is now pulled from a dict created in the get_images method which should be much faster than generating it on the fly, this is not implemented in the Monster class yet.
Moved the get_images method into the Character class and changed the Monster subclasses to use it to grab their images and hitmasks from it
Added file character.py which contains the base class info for Player and Monster classes to separate it out from the subclasses
Cleaned up imports to reduce some memory usage
minor changes to more PEP-8 compliant
minor changes to be more PEP-8 compliant

Started sorting out platform X movement, player at this point will move with platform while touching it, but will not carry inertia.
Player inertia has been implemented, at the moment the player will speed up and slow down at the same rate, this may become one value later.

some fixes for the platform moving on the X axis, still needs some tweaks, mainly player need to move with the platform a bit after leaving it, carrying the x_vel of the platform doesn't seem to be enough. Also need to fix player warping on top of platform when collidiing with sides, this may be a non-issue in actual gameplay as most horizantally moving platforms will be drop-down type.
Also made some tweaks to the 'fat_mask' for detecting walls when airborne, still needs more polish, also found that the normal wall detector needs tweaking, need to nail down final images for player to make them 'perfect'
Implemented contorllers, well at least an xbox controller, jumping and running and moving all seem to work, will need to implement more methods when other actions are added to the game.
minor changes
Added some collision between the player and mobs
basic collision and bouncing off of mobs working, need to integrate death animations and pass .kill() to mobs

Changed the take_damage method to push the character based on the location of what is doing damage, if what is doing damage is in the mid 16 pixels of a character (from something like a jump) the character that took damage will not move.
I also added some extra arguments to take_damage to input the offset, and velocity that the character taking damage will be pushed.
tweaked the area for no movement when damaging something, may need further tuning.

Cleaned up the code in main.py, changed the buttons to objects instead of creating the images in the loop (dunno wtf I was originally doing) so there is now a 'Button' Class in main.py that we can use to make the rest of the buttons, we may want to further tweak this to make the main screen more customizable
Changed over to new sprite sheets separating the characters ears from the body, currently the ears are not showing up, still trying to sort out why that image is not blitting to the screen correctly.

Ears are now showing up, forgot to tell it the rect location upon spawning. I also moved the ears to be instanciation of the ears object into the Player class itself, I will replicate this for the masks when we get there, this will allow the masks to spawn in without having to add them in the lvl section, and avoiding more additions to the .tmx file, this way we can also easily specify in the class of the monster if we want to have a mask type object or not.

option.value: Ears are now showing up, forgot to tell it the rect location upon spawning. I also moved the ears to be instanciation of the ears object into the Player class itself, I will replicate this for the masks when we get there, this will allow the masks to spawn in without having to add them in the lvl section, and avoiding more additions to the .tmx file, this way we can also easily specify in the class of the monster if we want to have a mask type object or not.
